subject: Alcoholic Beverages
Football
lead_paragraph: A Scottsdale, Ariz., jury found Tampa Bay tight end Jerramy Stevens guilty of driving under the influence of alcohol. Stevens, a former Seattle top pick, was arrested in March after the police stopped his car in downtown Scottsdale. Seattle let him become a free agent shortly afterward. Stevens faces a jail sentence of at least 30 days for “extreme” intoxication, a blood alcohol content of .15 percent or higher. The legal limit in Arizona is .08 percent; Stevens’ measured .20 percent. Coach Jon Gruden said he expected Stevens to play Sunday.
